climbs.name: Morning Salutes
climbs.fa: Who knows?  No beta we just went exploring and climbed.

content.description:
Climb is on the south side of the Radio Control Tower ridge.  When you have located the two erecting, prominent and unmistakeable rocks on the ridge go up.  Cross the bergschrund and head up the moderate snow ramp to the base of the rock band.   

  The rock band to access the ridge can be protected by a small alpine rack.  Once you have gained the ridge proper head west to Radio Control Tower placing pickets as you see fit and/or comfortable.   

  The ridge is classic, fun and steeper in many sections than we expected.  Great climb to get your crampons wet in the range.
content.protection: Small alpine rack   2-3 Cams to 2"    4 Nuts    1-2 Ice Screws    1-2 Pickets    60m or 70m Rope
content.location:
Head due west from Kahiltna base camp on the south side of Radio Control Tower.  You will pass 3 major couloirs start looking for two erecting, prominent and unmistakeable rocks on the ridge. 

Descent

  Retrace your steps along the ridge and rap or down climb the couloir to climbers right.

content.description:
Radio Control Tower, Annie's Ridge and the South Face of Mt. Francis are the closet areas to Kahiltna Base Camp.  Cragging, easy to moderate routes and a great place to dial in your systems and have some fun.  

  The west face has some rock routes on it, the glacier on the north side of Radio Control Tower provides easier access to the ridge.  The south face has a variety of couloirs ranging from moderate to difficult along with rock and mixed routes.
